― Since the earliest times, the history of Europe has been inextricably bound up with peoples and cultures from the east.
― It is an extraordinarily rich and complex relationship.
― Not only was Europe born and defined out of this relationship, but at every stage in its history it was intimately affected by the lands to the east.
⸺ Warwick Ball (2013). “Sultans Of Rome: The Turkish World Expansion” (1st edition). Series Introduction.
